title: The Heart of Mid-Lothian, Volume 2
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Roseneath, a smaller isle, lies much higher up the firth, and towards itswestern shore, near the opening of the lake called the Gare Loch, and notfar from Loch Long and Loch Scant, or the Holy Loch, which wind from themountains of the Western Highlands to join the estuary of the Clyde.

title: Seeing Europe with Famous Authors, Volume 2; Great Britain and Ireland, Part 2
author: Francis W. Halsey
snippet: Loch Lomond layunrolled under my feet like a beautiful map; just opposite, Loch Longthrust its head from between the feet of crowded hills to catch aglimpse of the giant.

title: Seeing Europe with Famous Authors, Volume 2; Great Britain and Ireland, Part 2
author: Francis W. Halsey
snippet: Loch Lomond layunrolled under my feet like a beautiful map; just opposite, Loch Longthrust its head from between the feet of crowded hills to catch aglimpse of the giant.

title: From Occident to Orient.
author: Smith, William Alexander.
snippet: Steamer is exchanged for coach again at this point for a short ride of two miles to Arrochar, on the northeastern corner of Loch Long.

title: From Occident to Orient.
author: Smith, William Alexander.
snippet: One may reverse the tour we are about to make^ — that is, take one of David MacBrayne's elegant little excursion steamers  at the Broomielaw in Scotland, descend the Clyde to the entrance of Loch Long, continuing on up the Loch to Inversnaid,  thence by coach to Loch Katrine, and thus qn to Edinburgh, and return to Glasgow, all this in one day, if he choose to pass Stirling and Edinburgh so hastily.

title: Over-sea;
author: Morford, Henry
snippet: We made a landing at Tarbet, on the left, for those of our passengers who were going to Arroquhar and Loch Long, or to catch the coach for luverary and the Argyle country of the " Legend of Montrose."

title: The Heart of Mid-Lothian.
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Roseneath, asmader isle, lies much higher up the Firth, and towards its westernshore, near the opening of the lake caded the Gare Loch, and notfar from Loch Long and Loch Seant, or the Holy Loch, which windfrom the mountains of the western Highlands to join the estuaryof the Clyde.

title: Art Rambles in the Highlands and Islands of Scotland ... With ... sketches, etc
author: Reid, John T.
snippet: Escaping from thebirches that line theroad, and descending on Arrochar andLoch Long, you canleisurely inspect theproportions of themountain Crispin.

title: Over-Sea; or, England, France and Scotland as seen by a live American ... With numerous illustrations, etc
author: Morford, Henry.
snippet: We made a landing at Tarbet, on the left, for those of ourpassangers who were going to Arroquhar and Loch Long, orto catch the coach for Inverary and the Argyle country ofthe "Legend of Montrose."

title: World: round it and over it ... letters ... With illustrations ... Second edition
author: Glass, Chester.
snippet: passing Loch Rest and Loch Long, we arrived at Tarbet,where we put up at the only hotel in the place, and a wellappointed one it was.
